title: Aerologix Expands "Uber for Drones" to North and South America with $2M Funding and Acquisition of Mappa
originSummary: Australian drone technology startup, Aerologix, has raised $2 million in capital and acquired global mapping software company, Mappa.
Dubbed the "Uber for drones," Aerologix connects drone operators with clients who require aerial imaging.
The company is expanding globally, with recent launches in New Zealand and a focus on North and South America.

title: India Aims to Become Global Drone Hub with Autonomous Drones by 2030
originSummary: India aims to become a global drone hub by 2030, with a focus on autonomous drones as a key driver of this goal.
Drones have already demonstrated their value in sectors like mining, infrastructure, and forest conservation by improving productivity and efficiency.

However, India needs to invest in research and development to further innovate and develop indigenous drone technology to achieve level 5 autonomy, where drones can make complex decisions independently.
Advancements in artificial intelligence, computer vision, sensor technology, and specialized knowledge in drone technology are required.

By investing in R&D and nurturing a skilled workforce, India can unlock the untapped potential of drone technology and leverage it for various applications, ranging from agriculture to disaster management.

title: The Importance of Friendships and Drones: Bobby Healy's Journey in Tech
originSummary: Bobby Healy, founder of Manna Drone Delivery and co-founder of Meili Travel Technology, shared his entrepreneurial journey and lessons learned at the WiT Singapore event.
He highlighted the significance of strong friendships and a solid team in achieving business success, using his previous venture, CarTrawler, as an example of restructuring.

He discussed the potential for disruption in the travel tech industry, provided insights on AI, and addressed the challenges faced by hardware businesses. He also expressed confidence in the future of Manna Drone Delivery and emphasized the importance of humility in entrepreneurial success.

title: Drone Pilots in High Demand: Find Your Career Path in the Evolving Industry
originSummary: The use of drones in various industries is increasing, creating a demand for drone pilots.
The number of registered drones in Canada has risen by 45% in the past two years.
Opportunities for careers solely focused on drone piloting are emerging as drone technology continues to advance.
To become a drone pilot in Canada, individuals need to obtain a Transport Canada Pilot Certificate.
Proposed regulations for flying Beyond Visual Line-of-sight (BVLOS) are being considered, which would expand opportunities for drone pilots.
Programs such as the Professional Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems program at the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology offer training for aspiring professional drone pilots.

title: Aerologix Acquires Mappa to Expand Drone Ecosystem
originSummary: Sydney-based drone technology startup Aerologix has acquired Brazilian mapping software company Mappa with the help of a $2 million capital raise.
The acquisition will support Aerologix's global expansion plans and enhance its comprehensive global drone ecosystem.
Mappa's mapping technology will be integrated into Aerologix's new offering, AerologixMaps, aimed at seamless integration into its existing drone ecosystem.

title: Iran Unveils Shaed-147 Drone for Advanced Surveillance
originSummary: Iran has introduced the Shaed-147, an advanced drone specifically designed for high altitude and long-endurance surveillance missions.
The Shaed-147 is expected to significantly enhance Iran's surveillance capabilities.
This new drone showcases Iran's ongoing efforts in the field of advanced technology and military capabilities.

title: Sydney drone startup Aerologix secures $2M funding, acquires mapping software company
originSummary: Australian drone technology startup Aerologix has secured $2 million in funding led by Nightingale Partners and Ellerston Capital to support its global expansion.

The company has acquired Brazilian mapping software company, Mappa, and integrated its technology into AerologixMaps, which offers an accessible and cost-effective solution for creating maps for drone pilots.
Aerologix is currently operational in New Zealand and is part of the Civil Aviation Safety Authority (CASA) digital sky platform, supporting 135 different drone models.

title: Aerologix Raises Funds and Acquires Mappa to Expand Global Drone Ecosystem
originSummary: Drone services company Aerologix has secured funding and acquired mapping software company Mappa to expand internationally and launch a new mapping solution called AerologixMaps.
The company's goal is to create a robust global drone ecosystem and has already enlisted over 29,000 drone pilots in Australia and New Zealand.
The funding round was led by Nightingale Partners, and the acquisition will generate additional revenue by monetizing the drone pilot network.
Aerologix has formed a partnership with Clean Up Australia Day to help tackle waste-related issues.
